Up until recently the covid vaccine was not tested and approved by the FDA‚Ä¶

It was tested - albeit not the full scope testing a vaccine normally undergoes - and received limited temporary approval as an emergency measure. For full approval, it undergoes more rigorous testing with wider sets of variables. For example, you'd not get a good read on the effect of a vaccine on pregnant women after only a 3-month test period - which was why it was not recommended for them until late 3rd trimester.

replies.context: FYI- I have no idea whether ivermectin is effective in any cases of COVID-19 infection. However, just because something is a "horse dewormer", doesn't mean it is not of specific use in humans. In fact, ivermectin is used to treat a number of parasitic infections in humans, including "River blindness" and "Elephantiasis". There are many drugs used to treat both horses and humans, including penicillin and other antibiotics, steroids, lasix, anesthetics, analgesics, gabapentin, and the list goes on.
